item.title: RT by @0xstark: Looking for a killer SVM engineer for a 1-mo PoC contract on intent-based interop to enable accessing Ethereum & L2 protocols via Solana wallets. You would sign a tx on Phantom and you'd get an account on any L2 or Ethereum that executes a batch of transactions. Cash.
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description: Looking for a killer SVM engineer for a 1-mo PoC contract on intent-based interop to enable accessing Ethereum & L2 protocols via Solana wallets. You would sign a tx on Phantom and you'd get an account on any L2 or Ethereum that executes a batch of transactions. Cash.

item.title:
R to @0xstark: 14. @PoolTogether_ is a decentralized no-loss lottery protocol.
Deposit funds to save while earning entries into prize draws funded by the yield on all deposits. PoolTogether is simply a better lottery: transparent, non-custodial, and community governed.
item.dc:creator: @0xstark
item.description:
14. @PoolTogether_ is a decentralized no-loss lottery protocol.

Deposit funds to save while earning entries into prize draws funded by the yield on all deposits. PoolTogether is simply a better lottery: transparent, non-custodial, and community governed.

item.title:
RT by @0xstark: You can now listen to more Devcon talks on the go. Check out the "Devcon Archives" podcast on your favorite podcast platform.
We've uploaded new episodes: - World Politics, World Building by @MacaesBruno - This Year in Ethereum by @0xstark - Real State of L2s by @bkiepuszewski - Programmable Cryptography and the Future of the Internet by @justinglibert - Programmable Cryptography and Ethereum by @gubsheep
item.dc:creator: @EFDevcon
item.description:
You can now listen to more Devcon talks on the go. Check out the "Devcon Archives" podcast on your favorite podcast platform.

We've uploaded new episodes:
- World Politics, World Building by @MacaesBruno
- This Year in Ethereum by @0xstark
- Real State of L2s by @bkiepuszewski
- Programmable Cryptography and the Future of the Internet by @justinglibert
- Programmable Cryptography and Ethereum by @gubsheep

item.title:
RT by @0xstark: More than 10,000 smart contracts deployed on Ethereum L2s over the last 24 hours.
We're planting the seeds of an onchain economy that will thrive for decades to come.
The future is onchain - the future is Ethereum.
item.dc:creator: @daddysether
item.description:

item.title:
R to @0xstark: 13. @Quark_ID enables every resident of @buenosaires to have a self-sovereign ID, powered by @zksync and Ethereum.
Intermediaries can't track how IDs are used, users can choose to share specific credentials and not others, and anyone can build on or extend the protocol.
item.dc:creator: @0xstark
item.description:
13. @Quark_ID enables every resident of @buenosaires to have a self-sovereign ID, powered by @zksync and Ethereum.

Intermediaries can't track how IDs are used, users can choose to share specific credentials and not others, and anyone can build on or extend the protocol.

item.dc:creator: @StatelessEth
item.description: Hello from the EF Stateless Consensus team! üëã We are a small team focused on solving scaling and related challenges by shipping stateless clients to Ethereum.

item.title: RT by @0xstark: The unsung heroes of Ethereum are the people behind testing and DevOps (like @ethPandaOps and @elbuenmayini ). People are drawn to shiny things‚Äînew research, the next big idea‚Äîbut often take the backbone of Ethereum for granted. Prysm encountered consensus edge cases in both Mekong and Devnet5 that could have caused a fork on mainnet if left unnoticed. These tricky edge cases are typically caught only through tireless effort of those dedicated to breaking things. Next time you see someone from Ethereum DevOps or testing team, don‚Äôt forget to say thank you‚Äîand maybe buy them a beer
item.dc:creator: @terencechain
item.description: The unsung heroes of Ethereum are the people behind testing and DevOps (like @ethPandaOps and @elbuenmayini ). People are drawn to shiny things‚Äînew research, the next big idea‚Äîbut often take the backbone of Ethereum for granted. Prysm encountered consensus edge cases in both Mekong and Devnet5 that could have caused a fork on mainnet if left unnoticed. These tricky edge cases are typically caught only through tireless effort of those dedicated to breaking things. Next time you see someone from Ethereum DevOps or testing team, don‚Äôt forget to say thank you‚Äîand maybe buy them a beer

item.title:
RT by @0xstark: Introducing our new video series: Core Notes from Core Devs!
Catch the Ethereum core developers at @offchainlabs discuss the latest happenings in Ethereum development.
This week we talk about the Pectra upgrade including upcoming preparations for devs and changes in store for users.
Time stamps:
0:09 What's one thing from the past two weeks of developments that you wish every Ethereum user understood better? 1:00 What does the Prysm team think about block builder specifications and does this differ from other teams? 2:07 What does the team think is the best approach to upgrading testnets? 3:52 Looking at the timeline discussions from the call, which changes in the coming months excite you the most? 6:23 We want your feedback!
item.dc:creator: @prylabs
item.description:
Introducing our new video series: Core Notes from Core Devs!

Catch the Ethereum core developers at @offchainlabs discuss the latest happenings in Ethereum development.

This week we talk about the Pectra upgrade including upcoming preparations for devs and changes in store for users.

Time stamps:

0:09 What's one thing from the past two weeks of developments that you wish every Ethereum user understood better?
1:00 What does the Prysm team think about block builder specifications and does this differ from other teams?
2:07 What does the team think is the best approach to upgrading testnets?
3:52 Looking at the timeline discussions from the call, which changes in the coming months excite you the most?
6:23 We want your feedback!

item.title:
RT by @0xstark: There has never been a better time to join Ethereum R&D.
Whatever your skills you could def contribute: - coordination - security - standards - system dev - snarks - chain economics - protocol spec n dev - education
This üëá is just the latest of many r&d fronts that Justin has been activating lately üöÄ
item.dc:creator: @0xalizk
item.description:
There has never been a better time to join Ethereum R&D.

Whatever your skills you could def contribute:
- coordination
- security
- standards
- system dev
- snarks
- chain economics
- protocol spec n dev
- education

This üëá is just the latest of many r&d fronts that Justin has been activating lately üöÄ

item.title:
RT by @0xstark: epic sequencing call #17!
Many founders, including 10 rollup founders, shared their support for based and/or native rollups. Below are some their quotes. 1h45min YouTube recording coming ASAP :)
Part 1‚Äîbased and native rollups
Ben Jones from @Optimism: "Let's get this right. Optimism is willing to support based sequencing and native execution. It's wartime."
Nick Johnson from @ensdomains: "You can count Namechain as based-pilled and native-pilled [...] and consider us fully onboard."
Jesse Pollak from @base: "We need to scale and connect the Ethereum ecosystem and based sequencing and native execution feel like the tools to do it."
Tomasz Stanczak from @NethermindEth: "Based and native rollups feel super aligned, they are what we're super excited about." "We will be experimenting with Surge, based rollups, and FABRIC."
Hayden Adams from @unichain: [couldn't make it; see recording for my Unichain take]
Steven Goldfeder from @arbitrum: "Diversity makes Ethereum unique [...] We need to find a common core - which is a native rollup, but not stifle innovation on top of it. [...] We're excited to contribute to this direction [...] All of us want Ethereum to win."
Fede Carrone from @class_lambda: "Based? For me, it clicked within seconds"
Ye Zhang from @Scroll_ZKP: "Based sequencing is an important way to stay in the same economic zone with Ethereum. [...] Native rollups are a super interesting idea!"
Part 2‚ÄîFABRIC: Fabric to Accelerate Based Rollup Infrastructure and Connectivity
Drew Van der Werff from @Commit_Boost: "FABRIC is a shelling point to coordinate and stitch together some of the fragmentation that has emerged"
mteam from @Spire_Labs: "Spire is devoting developer resources to native rollups." "We believe that a unified set of standards based rollups will lead to greater efficiency in development timelines, bring down costs for users, and establish a compatibility zone which is why we‚Äôre excited to announce our support of Fabric"
Daniel Wang from @taikoxyz: "we've been waiting for the FABRIC standards so we can work together and provide a full solution" "Taiko is willing to contribute to the Fabric project to make sure we can divide and conquer the problems"
Amir Forouzani from @puffer_finance: "Based rollups were a no-brainer for us, [...] so were native rollups." "FABRIC just makes so much sense, [...] these standardization efforts are so important"
Demi Brener from @OpenZeppelin: "We see based rollups as a promising path towards scaling Ethereum and billions of user." "We are supportive of the FABRIC efforts and are willing to contribute."
Sam Batternally from @rise_chain: "I am here to voice my support for FABRIC" "the signaling from Ethereum that this is the direction scaling is going which will be huge to pull off and attract more builders"
Vitalik Buterin: "our community thrives on open source, open research [...] It's amazing to see all of this interest and willingness to work together on sequencing and interoperability
item.dc:creator: @drakefjustin
item.description:
epic sequencing call #17!

Many founders, including 10 rollup founders, shared their support for based and/or native rollups. Below are some their quotes. 1h45min YouTube recording coming ASAP :)

Part 1‚Äîbased and native rollups

Ben Jones from @Optimism: "Let's get this right. Optimism is willing to support based sequencing and native execution. It's wartime."

Nick Johnson from @ensdomains: "You can count Namechain as based-pilled and native-pilled [...] and consider us fully onboard."

Jesse Pollak from @base: "We need to scale and connect the Ethereum ecosystem and based sequencing and native execution feel like the tools to do it."

Tomasz Stanczak from @NethermindEth: "Based and native rollups feel super aligned, they are what we're super excited about." "We will be experimenting with Surge, based rollups, and FABRIC."

Hayden Adams from @unichain: [couldn't make it; see recording for my Unichain take]

Steven Goldfeder from @arbitrum: "Diversity makes Ethereum unique [...] We need to find a common core - which is a native rollup, but not stifle innovation on top of it. [...] We're excited to contribute to this direction [...] All of us want Ethereum to win."

Fede Carrone from @class_lambda: "Based? For me, it clicked within seconds"

Ye Zhang from @Scroll_ZKP: "Based sequencing is an important way to stay in the same economic zone with Ethereum. [...] Native rollups are a super interesting idea!"

Part 2‚ÄîFABRIC: Fabric to Accelerate Based Rollup Infrastructure and Connectivity

Drew Van der Werff from @Commit_Boost: "FABRIC is a shelling point to coordinate and stitch together some of the fragmentation that has emerged"

mteam from @Spire_Labs: "Spire is devoting developer resources to native rollups." "We believe that a unified set of standards based rollups will lead to greater efficiency in development timelines, bring down costs for users, and establish a compatibility zone which is why we‚Äôre excited to announce our support of Fabric"

Daniel Wang from @taikoxyz: "we've been waiting for the FABRIC standards so we can work together and provide a full solution" "Taiko is willing to contribute to the Fabric project to make sure we can divide and conquer the problems"

Amir Forouzani from @puffer_finance: "Based rollups were a no-brainer for us, [...] so were native rollups." "FABRIC just makes so much sense, [...] these standardization efforts are so important"

Demi Brener from @OpenZeppelin: "We see based rollups as a promising path towards scaling Ethereum and billions of user." "We are supportive of the FABRIC efforts and are willing to contribute."

Sam Batternally from @rise_chain: "I am here to voice my support for FABRIC" "the signaling from Ethereum that this is the direction scaling is going which will be huge to pull off and attract more builders"

Vitalik Buterin: "our community thrives on open source, open research [...] It's amazing to see all of this interest and willingness to work together on sequencing and interoperability
